description: Discord embeds are a special type of message that allows you to present data with special formatting and structure. Custom embeds are a feature of Wynem that allow you to create your own embeds. This may be part of another command, or simply making one with the e!createembed/utility createembed command.

author: This is the Author
/assets/images/logo/logo.webp
data.title: This is the Title with a URL

description: Throughout this guide, there will be references to different sections of embeds. If you do not know what section is being mentioned, you can refer to the image above. To start creating a custom embed, first run the e!createembed/utility createembed command, and then click the button to start. If the custom embed is being created by another command, you can ignore this step.

data.description: Press the button to start creating a custom embed

description:
The first modal you will see is for the main content of the embed.
If you do not wish to include any of these, just click submit while leaving all fields blank.

rows: The large text appears near the top.
If you have a title, you can turn it into a clickable link with this URL.
The main content of an embed. Supports up to 4000 characters and appears beneath the title.
The colour of the bar up the side of the embed.

data.title: Embed Builder
rows: Turns the title into a clickable link (requires title)
Changes the colour of the bar up the side

description:
After each modal, you will be given the choice to add more content, skip past the suggested content types, or finish the embed.
The rest of this guide will assume you always choose the first button.

data.description: Press a button to continue creating the custom embed

description: The next modal you see allows you to add the author and footer to the embed.

rows: A row of small text that appears above the title.
A small image that appears to the left of the author.
This URL turns the author text in to a clickable link.
The small text at the bottom of the embed. Supports multiple lines.
A small image that appears to the left of the footer.

data.title: Embed Builder
rows: The small text at the top
An image to display next to the author (requires author)
Turns the author into a clickable link (requires author)
The small text at the bottom
An image to display next to the footer (requires footer)

description: The third modal is for adding both the main and thumbnail image to the embed.

rows: The URL for main image, which is the large image in the middle of the embed.
The URL for the small image in the top right corner of the embed.

data.title: Embed Builder
rows: A large image in the middle
A small image on the top right

description:
Next you will have the option to add up to 25 fields to your custom embed.
Fields are small sections in the middle of the embed.
Skipping a single field will skip all remaining fields.

rows: The main text of the field. Appears beneath the title.

Fields can be set to be inline, which is where they are allowed to be on the same row as another field. Up to three fields can appear on a single row.
This input is a simple yes or no.

data.title: Embed Builder
rows: would you like the field to be inline?

description:
Finally, you will be able to add up to 25 buttons to your custom embed.
Buttons are special links that appear beneath the embed.

There are 5 rows of buttons, which support up to 5 buttons each.
You must have at least 1 button on a row to have another row.
Skipping the first button in a row will skip all remaining buttons, whereas skipping any other button will skip the rest of the current row.

rows: The text that is displayed on the button.
The URL to go to when you click on the button.

data.title: Embed Builder
rows: The URL to go to when clicking the button

description:
Some commands that use custom embeds do not support buttons.


Congratulations, you are finished. You have now created a custom embed!
